title: Build a Budget Tracker API
description:
Create a FastAPI application for tracking budget categories with:
- GET /categories/ - List all budget categories
- GET /categories/{category_id} - Get a specific category
- POST /categories/ - Create a new category with name and budget limit
- GET /categories/{category_id}/remaining - Calculate remaining budget

Use Pydantic models for validation and include proper error handling.
instructions:
Create a FastAPI application for tracking budget categories with:
- GET /categories/ - List all budget categories
- GET /categories/{category_id} - Get a specific category
- POST /categories/ - Create a new category with name and budget limit
- GET /categories/{category_id}/remaining - Calculate remaining budget

Use Pydantic models for validation and include proper error handling.

hints.text: Use Field(..., gt=0) for required positive numbers. Use HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='message') for not found errors.
For remaining budget, calculate: budget_limit - spent. Return a dict or create a RemainingBudget Pydantic model.
Check if category_id in categories_db before accessing. Use global next_id and increment after creating each category.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to raise HTTPException for missing resources
commonMistakes.consequence: KeyError or None returned instead of proper 404
commonMistakes.correction: Always check if resource exists and raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='...')

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using Field() for validation constraints
commonMistakes.consequence: Invalid data like negative amounts accepted
commonMistakes.correction: Use Field(..., gt=0) for positive numbers, Field(default=0, ge=0) for non-negative

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to increment next_id after creating
commonMistakes.correction: Always increment next_id after successful creation: next_id += 1
